title: SQL Basics
description: Test your knowledge of SQL fundamentals, including queries, joins, and basic database operations.

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to retrieve data from a database?
Which clause is used to filter records in an SQL query?
Which SQL statement is used to insert new records into a table?
What does the SQL 'JOIN' operation do?
answers: Combines rows from two or more tables based on a related column
Adds new columns to an existing table
Updates the values of columns in a table

questions.question: Which of the following is used to define a primary key in SQL?
Which SQL command is used to remove a table from a database?
What is the purpose of the SQL 'ORDER BY' clause?
answers: Sort the results of a query
Filter the results of a query
Group the results of a query

questions.question: Which of the following is used to change the structure of an existing SQL table?
Which data type is used to store text in SQL?
Which SQL function is used to count the number of rows in a table?

title: Database Design
description: Test your understanding of designing efficient and normalized databases, including relationships and schemas.

questions.question: What does database normalization primarily aim to achieve?
Which normal form eliminates transitive dependency?
In a relational database, what is a 'foreign key'?
answers: A column that links to the primary key of another table
A unique identifier for each record
A column that stores unique values
A column that stores date values

questions.question: What is a schema in a relational database?
answers: The structure that defines the organization of data

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of relationship in a database?
Which of the following is a feature of a 'many-to-many' relationship?
answers: Requires a junction table to implement

questions.question: What is the purpose of indexing in a database?
answers: To speed up data retrieval operations
To store backup copies of data
To restrict user access to data

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a primary key?
answers: It uniquely identifies each record in a table
It is used to link tables together
It is not mandatory in every table

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid SQL join type?
In a database, what is a 'transaction'?
answers: A sequence of operations that are executed as a single unit
A method for storing large data

questions.question: Which of the following ensures that a database transaction is reliable and consistent?
Which normalization form eliminates partial dependency?

title: NoSQL Databases
description: Test your knowledge of NoSQL databases, including key concepts like document, column-family, graph, and key-value stores.

questions.question: Which of the following is a NoSQL database type?
Which NoSQL database is known for storing data in key-value pairs?
Which of the following is a key feature of a document-based NoSQL database?
answers: Data is stored in JSON or BSON format
Data is stored in tables with rows and columns

questions.question: What is the main use case for a graph database?
answers: Storing large amounts of tabular data
Handling massive amounts of time-series data

questions.question: Which of the following NoSQL databases is best known for horizontal scalability?
Which of the following is a feature of column-family NoSQL databases?
answers: Data is stored in columns rather than rows
Data is organized into key-value pairs
Stores data in hierarchical tree structures

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a graph-based NoSQL database?
What is a key advantage of NoSQL databases over traditional relational databases?
Which NoSQL database is commonly used for real-time analytics and can scale horizontally?
What is a feature of a key-value store?
answers: Data is stored in pairs of keys and values
Uses a relational model for data
Data is stored in tables with rows and columns

questions.question: Which NoSQL database is known for its document-oriented approach?
Which of the following is true about NoSQL databases?
answers: They are typically used for large-scale, distributed data
They do not support high availability

title: Database Optimization
description: Test your understanding of optimizing database performance, including indexing, query optimization, and caching techniques.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of database indexing?
Which of the following query optimizations can improve performance?
answers: Using indexes on frequently queried columns

questions.question: Which of the following indexing techniques is best for improving search performance on large text columns?
What is database denormalization used for?
answers: To reduce the number of joins needed in queries

questions.question: Which of the following strategies is useful for improving the performance of complex queries?
Which type of database index is best suited for searching large numeric data sets?
Which of the following methods can improve the performance of SELECT queries?
answers: Using LIMIT to reduce the number of rows retrieved

questions.question: Which of the following is a technique used to handle large amounts of data in a distributed database system?
What is the impact of using too many indexes in a database?
answers: It can slow down write operations
It improves query performance for all queries
It reduces the disk space usage

questions.question: What is a common method for optimizing database writes?
answers: Increasing the number of indexes on write-heavy tables
